Defining an app¶

To define an app, you:

  1. Create a proper Fantom pod with build.fan file in it. This file will be used by Spectre to build your app.
  2. In this pod you create a class extending Settings. There should be only one such class. This class will be an entry point to your application.
  3. In the constructor of your Settings class you define:
    • routes (by assigning Router to the Settings.routes),
    • middlewares (by assigning list of Middleware-s to the Settings.middlewares), if any,
    • template renderer (by assigning MustacheRenderer to the Settings.renderer).
  4. If you are going to serve WebSockets, see websockets for how to define WebSockets handler.
class Settings¶
appDir¶

File. Will be set in make from params. Use this to set up templates dir relative to appDir, for example.

debug¶

Whether your app is in debug mode or not.

wsProcessor(WsHandshakeReq req)¶

This method should return WsProcessor instance that will process this WebSocket connection. See WsActor.

root()¶

Override this to construct Turtle-s hierarchy all by yourself.
